name: Evostock-2017
tagline: EVO STAR, EVOSTOCK 2016 - 2017 is the Leading European Event on Bio-Inspired Computation. April 2017
body:
# Evostock-2017 EVO STAR, EVOSTOCK 2016 - 2017 is the Leading European Event on Bio-Inspired Computation. April 2017 .Pilot project: the development of online tools for beginning teachers and their mentors. https://etendering.ted.europa.eu/cft/cft-display.html?cftId=1625 The overall objective of this contract is to contribute to the improvement of European-level policy development in education and training. The specific objective of this contract is to increase self-efficacy of beginning teachers to become effective professionals. It will involve the development of online peer networks for (a) beginning teachers and (b) their mentors, as well as (c) an online professional development course for mentors of student school teachers. 2 3

EvoCOMNET 2017

4 5 6

Application of Nature-inspired Techniques for Communication Networks and 7 other Parallel and Distributed Systems

8 9 10 11 12 13 14 15 16 EvoCOMNET solicits contributions dealing with the application of ideas from natural processes and systems to the definition, analysis, and development of novel sequential, parallel, and distributed evolutionary computation approaches to the solution of problems of practical and theoretical interest in all domains related to network systems. Use and tuning of hybrid computational approaches based on evolutionary techniques are also welcome. 17 Topics of interest include, but are not limited to: 18
    19
  • Communication systems: Telecommunication, mobile, satellite, voice, and optical communications, Distributed inference and cooperative communication systems, Network analysis and design, Switching and Routing
    • 20
  • Networks: Sensor networks, Mobile ad hoc networks, Peer-to-peer networks, Distributed search and computing in peer-to-peer networks, Network protection systems, Network robotics and sensor-actor networks
    • 21
  • Network-related issues: Parallel and distributed optimization algorithms, Grid and cloud computing, Load balancing, routing, scheduling, and mapping in network-based computing systems, Quality-of-service provisioning, Distributed data mining
    • 22
  • Abstract network systems: Transportation, Supply, Logistics, Traffic management and simulation, Social network systems, Financial and economic network systems
    • 23
  • Real-world implementations
    • 24
25 26 27 28

SUBMISSION DETAILS

29

Submissions must be original and not published elsewhere. They will be 30 peer reviewed by at least three members of the program committee. 31 The reviewing process will be double-blind, so please omit information 32 about the authors in the submitted paper.

33 34

Submit your manuscript in Springer LNCS format.

35 36

Please provide up to five keywords in your Abstract

37 38

Page limit: 16 pages.

39 40 41 42

PUBLICATION DETAILS

43

Accepted papers will appear in the proceedings of EvoStar, published in a volume of the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science, 44 which will be available at the Conference. The authors of accepted papers will have to improve their paper on the basis of the reviewers 45 comments and will be asked to send a camera ready version of their manuscripts. At least one author of each accepted work has to register for the 46 conference and attend the conference and present the work.

47 48 49 50

FURTHER INFORMATION

51 Further information on the conference and co-located events can be 52 found in: http://www.evostar.org. 53 54 55
